item.title: From Riley Keough and Albert Serra to Highly Anticipated Debuts: 8 Catalan Projects to Watch in 2026
item.description: Despite not yet having wrapped a stellar 2025 — crowned by a whopping 27 projects featured at Spain’s prestigious San Sebastián Film Festival — the Catalan film industry is already looking ahead.&#160

item.title: Strong Catalan Presence in San Sebastián Crowns History-Making Year for Burgeoning Spanish Region
item.description: Catalan cinema has had a history-making year. For the first time, two films from Catalan producers have been selected in main competition in Cannes (Carla Simón’s “Romería” and Oliver Laxe’s “Sirât”),

item.title: The Carla Simón Legacy: Almost a Decade From ‘Summer 1993,’ Catalonia Continues to Generate Striking New Talent
item.description: Almost a decade on from Carla Simón’s striking “Summer 1993”, which amassed three Goya Awards, five Gaudí Awards, won best first feature at Berlin, and the Golden Biznaga in Málaga, Catalonia continue
